info.name: IGC - 11.7.0.0sp2
info.description: Full set of REST API endpoints and operations for Information Governance Catalog v11.7.0.0 with Service Pack 2.

request.description:
Create a custom attribute by passing in a JSON object with the required and optional properties.

- Required properties for all custom attribute types are "name", "appliesTo", and "attributeType". 
- Custom attributes of type predefined values require also property "validValues". 
- Custom attributes of type relationship require also properties "inverseName" and "targetReferences".

Responses:
- `400`	Bad request
- `401`	Unauthorized	
- `403`	Cannot create a custom attribute

Delete more than one custom attribute by their IDs

Responses:
- `400`	Bad request	
- `401`	Unauthorized	
- `403`	Cannot delete custom attributes	
- `404`	Custom attribute not found

Get the list of all custom attributes in the catalog

Responses:
- `400`	Bad request	
- `401`	Unauthorized

Edit a custom attribute

Parameters:
- `id`: The RID of the custom attribute.

Use the GET `/search/{type}` command to get the metadata about a specific asset type. In the Response Body area, find the asset name whose RID you need. The RID is the value in the `_id` property.

Responses:
- `400`	Bad request	
- `401`	Unauthorized	
- `403`	Cannot edit a custom attribute	
- `404`	Custom attribute not found

Get the details about a custom attribute by its ID

Parameters:

Use the GET `/search/{type}` command to get the metadata about a specific asset type. In the Response Body area, find the asset name whose RID you need. The RID is the value in the `_id` property.

Responses:
- `400`	Bad request	
- `401`	Unauthorized	
- `404`	Custom attribute not found

Update assets by passing in a JSON object with the updated properties in a field called `properties` as well as a field with a list of asset `ids`.

See the Examples section to see the syntax for modifying multi-reference values with the replace or the add mode.

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized	
- `403`	Cannot update assets	
- `404`	Asset not found

Create an asset by passing in a JSON object with the required and additional properties (currently supported: `term`, `category`, `information_governance_policy`, `information_governance_rule`, `collection`, `label`, `data_class`).

Must include a `_type` field as well as all required fields.

See the Examples section to see the syntax of the JSON object.

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized	
- `403`	Cannot create asset

Get an asset by its ID

Parameters:
- `id`: The RID of the asset.

Use the GET `/search/{type}` command to get the metadata about a specific asset type. In the Response Body area, find the asset name whose RID you need. The RID is the value in the `_id` property.

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized	
- `404`	Asset not found

response.name: byId

request.description:
Update an asset

Parameters:
- `id`: The RID of the asset 

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized	
- `403`	Cannot update asset	
- `404`	Asset not found

Any asset that can be deleted from the InfoSphere Information Governance Catalog user interface can be deleted by using the API, if you have the proper security role.

You cannot delete an asset when workflow is enabled, and the asset is in Draft or Pending Approval state in the development glossary. Instead, the asset will be marked for deletion.

If the asset is new and is not in the catalog yet, delete the asset by using the POST/workflow/discard API.

Parameters:
- `id`: The RID of the asset.

Use the GET `/search/{type}` command to get the metadata about a specific asset type. In the Response Body area, find the asset name whose RID you need. The RID is the value in the `_id` property. 

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized	
- `403`	Cannot delete asset	
- `404`	Asset not found

Get the property of an asset by the asset's ID and the property name

Parameters:
- `id`: The RID of the asset 
- `property`: The property name of the property to get. 

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized	
- `404`	Asset or property not found

Update a property of an asset

Parameters:
- `id`: The RID of the asset. 
- `property`: The property to update. 

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized	
- `404`	Asset or property not found

Create a data connection

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized	
- `400`	Bad Request

Responses:

Update a previously registered asset bundle.

The file format must follow the guidelines described at: http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21699130

Responses:

Register a new asset bundle.

The file format must follow the guidelines described at: http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21699130

Responses:

Parameters:

Responses:

- `404`	Bundle not found

Download a registered bundle as a zip file

Parameters:

Responses:
- `400`	Bad Request

Delete assets defined by asset bundles

The XML format must follow the guidelines described at: http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21699130

request.description:
Upload assets defined by asset bundles

The XML format must follow the guidelines described at: http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21699130

Export all bundle assets for specified family in XML format.

Responses:
- `400`	Bad Request

Get a data lineage report, as CSV (default) or PDF.

Parameters:
- `criteria`: The lineage report criteria.

As the only parameter, supply a criteria object in JSON format. See its JSON Data Type Model in POST `/flows/report`.
The returned report is in PDF format or CSV format (default), where each row represents one directed edge 'source - target'.
A convenient, exploratory way of creating data lineage requests:
1. Create and test lineage criteria using POST `/flows/report`.
2. Copy the JSON text into the `criteria` field of this endpoint.
3. The displayed URL should be usable in browser address fields, command-line tools, emails, ...

Trigger flow analysis of a DataStage job design, by its ID.

Parameters:
- `id`: The RID of the DataStage Job.

Use the GET `/search/{type}` command to get the metadata about a specific asset type. In the Response Body area, find the asset name whose RID you need. The RID is the value in the `_id` property.

Get a data lineage report regardless of criteria size, as CSV (default) or PDF.

Schema keys:
- `assetId` (string): The RID of the start asset.
- `fileType` (string, optional) [`CSV` or `PDF`]: Type of the file. Default is `CSV`.
- `reportType` (string, optional) [`DATA_LINEAGE` or `BUSINESS_LINEAGE`]: Type of the report. Default is `DATA_LINEAGE`.
- `filterNames` (array[string], optional): Names of filters to be applied. Lineage filters can be defined in Lineage Management.
- `templateName` (string, optional): Name of template to be applied. Lineage templates can be defined in Lineage Management.
- `flowTypes` (array[string], optional) [`DESIGN` or `OPERATIONAL` or `USER` or `OTHER_IMPACT`]: Flow types that should be included while building the lineage report. You can specify zero, one, or more flow types here.  When not specified at all, then all flows except for `OTHER_IMPACT` are included (default).  When specifying an empty array, then only static flows are included ('model-defined').
- `direction` (string, optional) [`UPSTREAM` or `DOWNSTREAM`]: Restrict to direction: UPSTREAM (incoming flows) or DOWNSTREAM (outgoing flows). When not specified, then the report will reflect both directions (default).
- `fieldIds` (array[string], optional): The RID(s) of the asset field(s).  Specify the RID(s) of the asset field(s) to generate lineage on a more detailed level. For example, when you create a lineage for a database table, you can select columns to generate lineage flow for each of the selected columns. Get the metadata about a specific asset field in the same way as for assetId.

Upload flow graph to the flows model.

XML format must follow the guidelines at: http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21699130

Get the URL of a data lineage report

Parameters:
- `criteria`: The lineage report criteria. See its JSON Data Type Model in POST `/flows/report`.

Get an XML snippet for using an asset in flow docs, by its ID.

Parameters:
- `id`: The RID of the asset.

Use the GET `/search/{type}` command to get the metadata about a specific asset type. In the Response Body area, find the asset name whose RID you need. The RID is the value in the `_id` property.

Search operates in 2 modes, ranked and query. When specifying search text and search-properties, the results are ranked, otherwise they are sorted alphabetically and can be paged using the next and previous urls in the paging section.
See the Examples section of the POST `/search` to see the syntax of the JSON object.

Search for assets in the catalog by posting a complex search request

See the Examples for detailed examples including a variety of different conditions.

Parameters:

Responses:
- `404`	Type not found

request.description:
Get the metadata about an asset type

Parameters:
- `id`: The value of `_id` in the GET `/types` command.  For example, `database_table` or `logical_data_model`.

Responses:
- `404`	Type not found

response.name: allTermProperties

request.description:
Adds comment to an asset

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized	
- `404`	Workflow is not enabled or asset does not exists.

Approve assets that are in the Pending Approval state.

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized

Disables workflow

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized	
- `404`	Workflow is not enabled yet. Enable it first.

Discard assets in Draft state

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized

Enables workflow.

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized	
- `404`	Workflow is already enabled. Disable it first.

Publish assets that are in the Approved state

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized

Request approval for assets that are in the Draft state

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized

Return assets that are in the Pending Approval or Approval state to Draft state

Responses:
- `401`	Unauthorized
